html: Management of ME fisheries should be based on the best available data & science, but that clearly hasn't happened here. On behalf of Maine's lobstermen, I urge NOAA Fisheries to postpone its rulemaking and engage with stakeholders to develop an accurate risk assessment tool. 6/
text: Management of ME fisheries should be based on the best available data & science, but that clearly hasn't happened here. On behalf of Maine's lobstermen, I urge NOAA Fisheries to postpone its rulemaking and engage with stakeholders to develop an accurate risk assessment tool. 6/

html: And the underlying data used in the risk assessment tool might not tell us the whole picture. Stakeholders tell us there’s a good chance the model generated by the tool won’t account for the present-day distributional shift of the right whales. 5/
text: And the underlying data used in the risk assessment tool might not tell us the whole picture. Stakeholders tell us there’s a good chance the model generated by the tool won’t account for the present-day distributional shift of the right whales. 5/

html: NOAA’s risk assessment tool is a scientific model with implications for thousands of Mainers and an entire species of whale, but it hasn’t been peer-reviewed. The tool wasn’t even made public until a few days ago. 4/
text: NOAA’s risk assessment tool is a scientific model with implications for thousands of Mainers and an entire species of whale, but it hasn’t been peer-reviewed. The tool wasn’t even made public until a few days ago. 4/

html: In the last 2 yrs, 12 of the 20 stranded right whales found were discovered in Canadian waters, where Canadian fishermen aren’t subject to the same whale protection measures. But the risk assessment tool fails to incorporate the impact of Canadian fisheries on whale deaths. 3/
text: In the last 2 yrs, 12 of the 20 stranded right whales found were discovered in Canadian waters, where Canadian fishermen aren’t subject to the same whale protection measures. But the risk assessment tool fails to incorporate the impact of Canadian fisheries on whale deaths. 3/

html: NOAA Fisheries' new restrictions are supposed to protect the right whale. But the method NOAA uses to justify these rules – called the ‘risk assessment tool’– uses data & assumptions that may be unreliable. More info here: https://golden.house.gov/media/press-releases/golden-asks-noaa-fisheries-postpone-new-right-whale-management-proposals … #mepolitics 2/pic.twitter.com/2CbTHwSeyn
text:
NOAA Fisheries' new restrictions are supposed to protect the right whale. But the method NOAA uses to justify these rules – called the ‘risk assessment tool’– uses data & assumptions that may be unreliable.

More info here: https://golden.house.gov/media/press-releases/golden-asks-noaa-fisheries-postpone-new-right-whale-management-proposals …

html: I joined members of both parties today to help pass #SaveTheNet Act. This common-sense bill: Reinstates #NetNeutrality for a free and open internet Takes power back for consumers Helps expand rural broadband and create jobs through programs like the Connect America Fund
text:
I joined members of both parties today to help pass #SaveTheNet Act.

This common-sense bill:
 Reinstates #NetNeutrality for a free and open internet
 Takes power back for consumers
 Helps expand rural broadband and create jobs through programs like the Connect America Fund

html: Investing in lead removal protects ME kids & returns $17-$221 to the taxpayer for every $1 spent. RT to tell @SecretaryCarson: Your agency isn't doing enough to protect our kids from lead. It's time to make meaningful investments to remove lead from American homes. #mepolitics
text:
Investing in lead removal protects ME kids & returns $17-$221 to the taxpayer for every $1 spent.

RT to tell @SecretaryCarson:
Your agency isn't doing enough to protect our kids from lead. It's time to make meaningful investments to remove lead from American homes.
#mepolitics

html: When asked about my proposal, @SecretaryCarson suggested we don’t need serious investments in lead removal. He said Maine kids should wait for technology to catch up. Maybe he doesn't know: in last 5 yrs, 1,800 ME kids were diagnosed with lead poisoning.https://www.sunjournal.com/2019/03/22/ben-carson-hails-efforts-to-remove-lead-from-lewiston-homes/ …

html: We can remove lead from **220,000 homes a year** Here's how: End federal involvement in the sale of foreclosed properties w/ lead hazards Raise lead exposure standards for state & local gov'ts receiving fed funds Invest serious resources in lead identification & removal
text:
We can remove lead from **220,000 homes a year**

Here's how:
 End federal involvement in the sale of foreclosed properties w/ lead hazards
 Raise lead exposure standards for state & local gov'ts receiving fed funds
 Invest serious resources in lead identification & removal

html: Earlier this week, we learned from @MAHCHousing that only about half of 1-year-olds in Maine are screened for lead exposure. That's a serious problem in our state, where 1,800 kids have been diagnosed with lead-poisoning in the last 5 years. https://mainehousingcoalition.org/new-research-shows-maine-kids-put-at-risk-by-poor-lead-screening-practices/ … #mepolitics 2/

html: Maine teachers pay into Social Security just like everyone else. But they don’t get anywhere near the full benefit when they retire. That's wrong. text:

html: I’ve been outspoken about skyrocketing Rx drug costs. My roadmap includes: Preventing abusive Rx price spikes Permitting Americans to import safe & cheap Canadian Rx Allowing Medicare to negotiate lower Rx prices Changing NAFTA to promote generic Rx competition 5/pic.twitter.com/Kz3xj5bHEL
text:
I’ve been outspoken about skyrocketing Rx drug costs. My roadmap includes:
 Preventing abusive Rx price spikes
 Permitting Americans to import safe & cheap Canadian Rx
 Allowing Medicare to negotiate lower Rx prices
 Changing NAFTA to promote generic Rx competition 5/pic.twitter.com/Kz3xj5bHEL

html: We introduced our FLAT Prices Act last week. It says that if a Rx company spikes drug prices by an unreasonable amount they more quickly lose their monopoly on that drug, helping lower costs and protect Maine people from price spikes on the drugs they need. Via @NewsCenterMainepic.twitter.com/p50RurKbLt
text:
We introduced our FLAT Prices Act last week. It says that if a Rx company spikes drug prices by an unreasonable amount they more quickly lose their monopoly on that drug, helping lower costs and protect Maine people from price spikes on the drugs they need.

Via @NewsCenterMainepic.twitter.com/p50RurKbLt

html: Thanks to @RepCasten, @RepSlotkin, @RepGilCisneros, @RepMaxRose, and @chelliepingree for joining me to introduce the FLAT Prices Act in the House. @SenatorDurbin, a long-time leader on fair Rx drug costs, introduced the bill in the Senate. I'm proud to join him in this effort.
text:
Thanks to @RepCasten, @RepSlotkin, @RepGilCisneros, @RepMaxRose, and @chelliepingree for joining me to introduce the FLAT Prices Act in the House. 

@SenatorDurbin, a long-time leader on fair Rx drug costs, introduced the bill in the Senate. I'm proud to join him in this effort.

html: We need common-sense solutions to lower healthcare costs. Addressing the rising cost of Rx drugs is a step we can take right now. Today, I introduced the FLAT Prices Act to help prevent abusive drug companies from jacking up drug prices on the American people. #mepoliticspic.twitter.com/krxR9U23pc
text:
We need common-sense solutions to lower healthcare costs. Addressing the rising cost of Rx drugs is a step we can take right now. 

Today, I introduced the FLAT Prices Act to help prevent abusive drug companies from jacking up drug prices on the American people. #mepoliticspic.twitter.com/krxR9U23pc

html: How do corporations get away with this? When they develop a new drug, the gov’t gives Rx companies a years-long monopoly. They can skyrocket prices with no competition. It’s a system intended to promote R&D, but many pharma companies abuse it on the backs of Maine people.
text:
How do corporations get away with this? 

When they develop a new drug, the gov’t gives Rx companies a years-long monopoly. They can skyrocket prices with no competition. It’s a system intended to promote R&D, but many pharma companies abuse it on the backs of Maine people.

html: Rx drug prices have been out of control for years, but in 2016 we saw just how abusive drug companies had become. In the space of 9 years, amid record profits, Mylan shot its prices for the life-saving allergy drug Epipen up by 400%https://www.nbcnews.com/business/economy/epipen-price-hike-has-parents-kids-allergies-scrambling-ahead-school-n633071 …
text: Rx drug prices have been out of control for years, but in 2016 we saw just how abusive drug companies had become. html: Higher Rx drug prices are one of the biggest drivers of rising healthcare costs. Maine people spend at least twice as much on prescription drugs as we did thirty years ago. Democrats, Republicans, and everyone in between agrees: this is a problem & we need to fix it.pic.twitter.com/RrQ0Xc1IK7
text:
Higher Rx drug prices are one of the biggest drivers of rising healthcare costs. Maine people spend at least twice as much on prescription drugs as we did thirty years ago. 

Democrats, Republicans, and everyone in between agrees: this is a problem & we need to fix it.pic.twitter.com/RrQ0Xc1IK7

html: I met with the Maine Medical Association to discuss how we can make healthcare more affordable for Maine people. One thing I brought up: the cost of prescription drugs. Year after year, Mainers get soaked by high drug prices. It's past time our country addressed this issue.pic.twitter.com/DbZecil8Oe
text:
I met with the Maine Medical Association to discuss how we can make healthcare more affordable for Maine people. 

One thing I brought up: the cost of prescription drugs. Year after year, Mainers get soaked by high drug prices. It's past time our country addressed this issue.pic.twitter.com/DbZecil8Oe

html: Heading into tonight's #SOTU2019, I was looking for areas where I could work with the president to get things done for Maine people. Here's what I took from the speech: https://bit.ly/2t5h6S5  #MEpolitics
text:
Heading into tonight's #SOTU2019, I was looking for areas where I could work with the president to get things done for Maine people. 

Here's what I took from the speech: https://bit.ly/2t5h6S5 
#MEpolitics

html: We’re hearing the president will call for both parties to put aside their differences & come together. I welcome that message, but he has to back it up with leadership. We need to see concrete proposals from @POTUS and willingness to work with both parties to get this done 11/
text: We’re hearing the president will call for both parties to put aside their differences & come together. I welcome that message, but he has to back it up with leadership. We need to see concrete proposals from @POTUS and willingness to work with both parties to get this done 11/

html: That’s why Maine needs strong federal funding to build infrastructure that grows our economy, creates good jobs, & connects our businesses and homes. I’ll be listening for @POTUS to seize the moment, work across the aisle, and outline a real infrastructure plan. #mepolitics 10/
text: That’s why Maine needs strong federal funding to build infrastructure that grows our economy, creates good jobs, & connects our businesses and homes. I’ll be listening for @POTUS to seize the moment, work across the aisle, and outline a real infrastructure plan. #mepolitics 10/

html: Here’s the thing: Maine isn’t NY or CA and we’re more than 90% small biz. An infrastructure plan that requires private investment and lots of state and local gov’t $$$ won’t work here. #mepolitics 9/
text: Here’s the thing: Maine isn’t NY or CA and we’re more than 90% small biz. An infrastructure plan that requires private investment and lots of state and local gov’t $$$ won’t work here. #mepolitics 9/

html: Investing in infrastructure is huge for #ME02. We’re 1 of the most rural districts in the US, & we’re the biggest east of the Mississippi. Bad roads, bridges, rail, & poor broadband internet access quite literally hold our families, workers, & businesses back. #mepolitics 8/
text: Investing in infrastructure is huge for #ME02. We’re 1 of the most rural districts in the US, & we’re the biggest east of the Mississippi. Bad roads, bridges, rail, & poor broadband internet access quite literally hold our families, workers, & businesses back. #mepolitics 8/

text: Here’s another area where I want to work with the president: INFRASTRUCTURE. There’s a real opportunity here for both parties to work together with @POTUS and get something done for Mainers. Few states would benefit more from better roads, bridges, etc than Maine. #mepolitics 7/

html: I’ll work with @POTUS when his policies help Mainers, but I’ll fight back when his policies hurt our state. I’ll work with the president to overhaul NAFTA if he's serious about protecting Maine jobs, but this deal comes up short. 6/ #mepolitics #replaceNAFTApic.twitter.com/41aiZiIWpA
text: I’ll work with @POTUS when his policies help Mainers, but I’ll fight back when his policies hurt our state. I’ll work with the president to overhaul NAFTA if he's serious about protecting Maine jobs, but this deal comes up short. 6/ #mepolitics #replaceNAFTApic.twitter.com/41aiZiIWpA

html: .@POTUS' NAFTA 2.0 must be changed to do more to keep good jobs in Maine and increase wages. And trade deals aren’t worth the paper they’re written on if other countries don’t play by the rules, so we need stronger enforcement provisions. #mepolitics 5/
text: .@POTUS' NAFTA 2.0 must be changed to do more to keep good jobs in Maine and increase wages. And trade deals aren’t worth the paper they’re written on if other countries don’t play by the rules, so we need stronger enforcement provisions. #mepolitics 5/

html: The president’s NAFTA 2.0 proposal appears to be more of the same. It looks like a new paint job on the old NAFTA, not the meaningful change we need. Too many Maine communities know where this path leads: closed mills, outsourcing, and low wage jobs. #mepolitics 4/
text: The president’s NAFTA 2.0 proposal appears to be more of the same. It looks like a new paint job on the old NAFTA, not the meaningful change we need. Too many Maine communities know where this path leads: closed mills, outsourcing, and low wage jobs. #mepolitics 4/

html: Maine people want: Protections for pre-existing conditions Medicaid coverage for 70,000 Maine people Mainers under 26 to have access to their parents' plans (1/2)
text:

 Protections for pre-existing conditions

html: We need to strengthen our borders. But shutting down the gov't to demand more money for the president's unrealistic, irresponsible wall hurts Maine & doesn’t get us closer to a secure border. I’m working with both parties to get the gov't working again and put people first (3/3)
text: We need to strengthen our borders. But shutting down the gov't to demand more money for the president's unrealistic, irresponsible wall hurts Maine & doesn’t get us closer to a secure border. I’m working with both parties to get the gov't working again and put people first (3/3)

html: I voted with Republicans & Democrats to reopen the government last week. The bills we passed strengthen the border & build physical barriers where they're effective. Just as important for Maine, the bills fund infrastructure projects, open nat'l parks, & pay gov't employees (2/3)
text: I voted with Republicans & Democrats to reopen the government last week. The bills we passed strengthen the border & build physical barriers where they're effective. Just as important for Maine, the bills fund infrastructure projects, open nat'l parks, & pay gov't employees (2/3)

html: The gov’t shutdown means many Maine people aren’t getting their paychecks, many Maine small businesses and their workers are hurting, and services Mainers rely on aren’t functioning. This is bad for people in our state, and it’s only going to get worse (1/3)

html: We opened our offices in Lewiston and Caribou this week! We're here to listen to and work for Maine people. If you need assistance with federal programs like Medicare, Social Security, and the VA, we're here to help. Lewiston: 179 Lisbon St. Caribou: 7 Hatch Drive, Suite 230pic.twitter.com/1kXSEtm7TM
text:
We opened our offices in Lewiston and Caribou this week! 
We're here to listen to and work for Maine people. If you need assistance with federal programs like Medicare, Social Security, and the VA, we're here to help.

Lewiston: 179 Lisbon St. 

Caribou: 7 Hatch Drive, Suite 230pic.twitter.com/1kXSEtm7TM

html: Just finished my first day as a Congressman. I am honored and proud to represent Maine's second district. Today, we took a critical step to end the partial government shutdown. But that's just the beginning. We're ready to listen, get to work, and put people first.pic.twitter.com/AG4OEJdC6B
text:
Just finished my first day as a Congressman. I am honored and proud to represent Maine's second district. 

Today, we took a critical step to end the partial government shutdown. But that's just the beginning. We're ready to listen, get to work, and put people first.pic.twitter.com/AG4OEJdC6B
